It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The plant has a prostrate growth habit with closely spaced, leaf-like structures called phyllodes. Its dark green leaves are often covered in a layer of fine, waxy scales, which help reduce water loss. Lepiderema melanorrhachis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
